item.title: Coord spammer|| post your Misc.methods lol
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

Strucker:

Well if you wanna explore new locations and are too lazy to type random coords,

[quote=“Vain_, post:15, topic:513390”]would only be useful for when randomly teleporting and finding locations you’ve never seen/heard of.

would be more useful in a program: load runescape map/align clicking per coordinate (believe 1 pixel is 4 tiles?) and draw tooltips or an icon where a tile has been saved[/quote]

[quote=“Vain_, post:17, topic:513390”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=631636.msg4352229#msg4352229 date=1376858226]

would only be useful for when randomly teleporting and finding locations you’ve never seen/heard of.

would be more useful in a program: load runescape map/align clicking per coordinate (believe 1 pixel is 4 tiles?) and draw tooltips or an icon where a tile has been saved

They had something like this when RSBuddy was around, I can’t remember the name of it (It may still be on pb). It was a .jar of the map and you could like get tile data and find walking paths from point A to B.
[/quote]steven released a tool for dementhium he made, which worked exactly as described above (except for saving specific locations like I did, you could save npc spawns through his tool though). don’t believe it’s around anymore though. :([/quote]

[quote=“Vain_, post:332, topic:523969”]how do you find coordinates? random tele + run? coordinates list?
cus steven’s coordinate tool works great

[/quote]

use a more friendly approach rather than just randomly teleporting…

item.title: Coord spammer|| post your Misc.methods lol
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Fox2007, post:6, topic:533952”] int x = 0; int y = 0; x = Misc.random(4000, 6000); y = Misc.random(4000, 6000);

thats not redundant at all lol…

int x = Misc.random(4000, 6000);
int y = Misc.random(4000, 6000);

Here’s a couple more things for your Misc.java

	/**
	 * @param hex
	 * @return true if the string contains only 0-9 and letters A-F
	 */
	public static boolean isValidHex(String hex) {
		return hex.matches("[0-9A-F]+");
	}
	
	/**
	 * @return the number with commas
	 */
	public static String formatNumber(int num) {
		return NumberFormat.getInstance().format(num);
	}
	
	/**
	 * @param time in milliseconds
	 * @return the time remaining
	 */
	public static String getTimeRemaining(long time) {
		long timeLeft = (time - System.currentTimeMillis());
		long hours = TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.toHours(timeLeft);
		long min = TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.toMinutes(timeLeft) - TimeUnit.HOURS.toMinutes(TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.toHours(timeLeft));
		long sec = TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.toSeconds(timeLeft) - TimeUnit.MINUTES.toSeconds(TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.toMinutes(timeLeft));
		return ""+hours+"hrs. "+min+"min. "+sec+"sec.";
	}
	
	/**
	 * @param name or word
	 * @return true if it starts with a vowel
	 */
	public static boolean startsWithVowel(String name) {
		String[] VOWELS = { "a", "e", "i", "o", "u" };
		for (String n : VOWELS) {
			if (name.toLowerCase().startsWith(n)) {
				return true;
			}
		}
		return false;
	}
	
	/**
	 * @return the amount of time the server has been online.
	 */
    public static long serverUptime() {
    	return ManagementFactory.getRuntimeMXBean().getUptime();
	}

tehee. The valid hex method was used for setting custom colors…just something random XD[/quote]
The only reason I did that was because if I were to assign the variable instead of doing

int x = Misc.random(4000, 6000);
int y = Misc.random(4000, 6000);

was because then I could print out the correct coordinates since when you assign them, it doesnt randomize upon every call.

item.dc:creator: @Fox2007 Fox2007
item.description:
@Fox2007 wrote:

int x = 0;
int y = 0;
x = Misc.random(4000, 6000);
y = Misc.random(4000, 6000);

thats not redundant at all lol…

int x = Misc.random(4000, 6000);
int y = Misc.random(4000, 6000);

Here’s a couple more things for your Misc.java

	/**
	 * @param hex
	 * @return true if the string contains only 0-9 and letters A-F
	 */
	public static boolean isValidHex(String hex) {
		return hex.matches("[0-9A-F]+");
	}
	
	/**
	 * @return the number with commas
	 */
	public static String formatNumber(int num) {
		return NumberFormat.getInstance().format(num);
	}
	
	/**
	 * @param time in milliseconds
	 * @return the time remaining
	 */
	public static String getTimeRemaining(long time) {
		long timeLeft = (time - System.currentTimeMillis());
		long hours = TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.toHours(timeLeft);
		long min = TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.toMinutes(timeLeft) - TimeUnit.HOURS.toMinutes(TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.toHours(timeLeft));
		long sec = TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.toSeconds(timeLeft) - TimeUnit.MINUTES.toSeconds(TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.toMinutes(timeLeft));
		return ""+hours+"hrs. "+min+"min. "+sec+"sec.";
	}
	
	/**
	 * @param name or word
	 * @return true if it starts with a vowel
	 */
	public static boolean startsWithVowel(String name) {
		String[] VOWELS = { "a", "e", "i", "o", "u" };
		for (String n : VOWELS) {
			if (name.toLowerCase().startsWith(n)) {
				return true;
			}
		}
		return false;
	}
	
	/**
	 * @return the amount of time the server has been online.
	 */
    public static long serverUptime() {
    	return ManagementFactory.getRuntimeMXBean().getUptime();
	}

tehee. The valid hex method was used for setting custom colors…just something random XD

item.title: Coord spammer|| post your Misc.methods lol
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Strucker:

well ty for the random method–

My Misc has a buncha things I bet you’ll love:

package org.rs2server.rs2.util;

import java.util.Random;

public class Misc {

    public static int distance(int absX, int absY, int pointX, int pointY) {
        //return (int) Math.sqrt(Math.pow(absX - pointX, 2) + Math.pow(absY - pointY, 2));
        return (int) Math.sqrt((absX - pointX) * (absX - pointX) + (absY - pointY) * (absY - pointY));
    }
    // gets the direction between the two given points
    // valid directions are N:0, NE:2, E:4, SE:6, S:8, SW:10, W:12, NW:14
    // the invalid (inbetween) direction are 1,3,5,7,9,11,13,15 i.e. odd integers
    // returns -1, if src and dest are the same

    public static int direction(int srcX, int srcY, int destX, int destY) {
        int dx = destX - srcX, dy = destY - srcY;
        // a lot of cases that have to be considered here ... is there a more sophisticated (and quick!) way?
        if (dx < 0) {
            if (dy < 0) {
                if (dx < dy) {
                    return 11;
                } else if (dx > dy) {
                    return 9;
                } else {
                    return 10;        // dx == dy
                }
            } else if (dy > 0) {
                if (-dx < dy) {
                    return 15;
                } else if (-dx > dy) {
                    return 13;
                } else {
                    return 14;        // -dx == dy
                }
            } else {    // dy == 0
                return 12;
            }
        } else if (dx > 0) {
            if (dy < 0) {
                if (dx < -dy) {
                    return 7;
                } else if (dx > -dy) {
                    return 5;
                } else {
                    return 6;        // dx == -dy
                }
            } else if (dy > 0) {
                if (dx < dy) {
                    return 1;
                } else if (dx > dy) {
                    return 3;
                } else {
                    return 2;        // dx == dy
                }
            } else {    // dy == 0
                return 4;
            }
        } else {        // dx == 0
            if (dy < 0) {
                return 8;
            } else if (dy > 0) {
                return 0;
            } else {    // dy == 0
                return -1;        // src and dest are the same
            }
        }
    }

    /**
     * Gets the indefinite article of a 'thing'.
     *
     * @param thing The thing.
     * @return The indefinite article.
     */
    public static String getIndefiniteArticle(String thing) {
        char first = thing.toLowerCase().charAt(0);
        boolean vowel = first == 'a' || first == 'e' || first == 'i' || first == 'o' || first == 'u';
        return vowel ? "an" : "a";
    }

    /**
     * Returns a random integer with min as the inclusive lower bound and max as
     * the exclusive upper bound.
     *
     * @param min The inclusive lower bound.
     * @param max The exclusive upper bound.
     * @return Random integer min <= n < max.
     */
    public static int random(int min, int max) {
        Random random = new Random();
        int n = Math.abs(max - min);
        return Math.min(min, max) + (n == 0 ? 0 : random.nextInt(n));
    }

    public static String Hex(byte data[]) {
        return Hex(data, 0, data.length);
    }

    public static String Hex(byte data[], int offset, int len) {
        String temp = "";
        for (int cntr = 0; cntr < len; cntr++) {
            int num = data[offset + cntr] & 0xFF;
            String myStr;
            if (num < 16) {
                myStr = "0";
            } else {
                myStr = "";
            }
            temp += myStr + Integer.toHexString(num) + " ";
        }
        return temp.toUpperCase().trim();
    }

    public static int HexToInt(byte data[], int offset, int len) {
        int temp = 0;
        int i = 1000;
        for (int cntr = 0; cntr < len; cntr++) {
            int num = (data[offset + cntr] & 0xFF) * i;
            temp += (int) num;
            if (i > 1) {
                i = i / 1000;
            }
        }
        return temp;
    }

    public static Random random = new Random();

    public static int random(int range) {
        return (int) (java.lang.Math.random() * (range + 1));
    }

    public static int random2(int range) { //1 till range
        return (int) ((java.lang.Math.random() * range) + 1);
    }

    public static int random3(int range) { //0 till range
        return (int) (java.lang.Math.random() * range);
    }

    public static int random4(int range) { //0 till range (range INCLUDED)
        return (int) (java.lang.Math.random() * (range + 1));
    }
}

    /**
     * Returns a random integer with min as the inclusive lower bound and max as
     * the exclusive upper bound.
     *
     * @param min The inclusive lower bound.
     * @param max The exclusive upper bound.
     * @return Random integer min <= n < max.

    }
                if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("randomcoords")) {
                    World.getWorld().submit(new Event(5000) {
                        /**
                         * The execute method is called when the event is run. The general contract
                         * of the execute method is that it may take any action whatsoever.
                         */
                        @Override
                        public void execute() {
                            int x = 0;
                            int y = 0;
                            x = Misc.random(4000, 6000);
                            y = Misc.random(4000, 6000);
                            player.setTeleportTarget(Location.create(x, y, 0));
                            player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Coords: " + x + ", " + y);
                        }
                    });
                }

item.source: Coord spammer|| post your Misc.methods lol

item.title: Coord spammer|| post your Misc.methods lol
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

Well if you wanna explore new locations and are too lazy to type random coords, this will tele all players in server to random coods every 5 ticks

[code]package server.euthymia.entity.player.misc;

import server.Server;
import server.euthymia.entity.player.Player;
import server.euthymia.entity.player.PlayerHandler;
import server.task.Task;

public class CoordSpammer {

/*
 * Gets a random x coordinate
 */
public static int getX() {
	switch (Misc.random(5)) {
	case 0:
		return 1000 + Misc.random(900);
	case 1:
		return 2000 + Misc.random(900);
	case 2:
		return 3000 + Misc.random(900);
	case 3:
		return 4000 + Misc.random(900);
	case 4:
		return 5000 + Misc.random(900);
	}
	return 0;
}

/*
 * Gets a random y coord.
 */
public static int getY() {
	switch (Misc.random(5)) {
	case 0:
		return 1000 + Misc.random(900);
	case 1:
		return 2000 + Misc.random(900);
	case 2:
		return 3000 + Misc.random(900);
	case 3:
		return 4000 + Misc.random(900);
	case 4:
		return 5000 + Misc.random(900);
	}
	return 0;
}

public static void movePlayers() {
	Server.getTaskScheduler().schedule(new Task(2, true) {
		private int count = 5;

		@Override
		protected void execute() {

			if (count > 0) {
				PlayerHandler.messageToAll = count + "...";
				count--;
			} else {
				for (int i = 0; i < Server.playerHandler.players.length; i++) {
					Player p = Server.playerHandler.players[i];
					if (p == null) {
						continue;
					}
					p.toX = getX();
					p.toY = getY();
					p.sM("You've been moved to x = "+getX()+" y = "+getY()+" ");
					movePlayers();
					stop();
				}
			}
		}
	});
}

}[/code]
